author: chfast
content:
<@547171287831805972> <@755913785620824175> <@892053833121923094> thanks for presentation this all looks nice. 

I was the main complainer that execution-spec-tests does not support state tests and state test format is what evmone works with (not only execution but also test generation and fuzzing).

On the other hand, blockchain tests is a superset of state tests and there is big duplication between two formats. Some teams happily consume blockchain format only.

We can research and discuss the details. You can point me to the best place for discussion. But if to deprecate the state test format we need a migration plan up front.

However, EIP-4844 only having blockchain tests is quite a pain.

author: holiman
content: Nope, bl tests are not a superset. Statetests can contain invalid transactions and verify that they are rejected, which a bl test cannot.
